biotools.summary: mmeta is a program to produce and to align the TF-maps of multiple promoter regions. mmeta is very powerful to characterize promoter regions from multiple orthologous genes, or from co-regulated genes in microarrays, as it reduces the signal/noise ratio in a very significant manner, still detecting the real functional sites.

bioschemas.name: mmeta
bioschemas.summary: mmeta is a program to produce and to align the TF-maps of multiple promoter regions. mmeta is very powerful to characterize promoter regions from multiple orthologous genes, or from co-regulated genes in microarrays, as it reduces the signal/noise ratio in a very significant manner, still detecting the real functional sites.
